label: Constitution amendment
description: Mechanisms to change the text of the constitution, including constitutional amendment, reform, or replacement

label: Unamendable
description: Parts of the constitutions that are so fundamental that they are unamendable

parent_category: Culture and Identity/Citizenship; Culture and Identity/Indigenous Groups; Rights and Duties/Equality, Gender, and Minority Rights
label: Indigenous citizenship
description: Grants indigenous peoples the status of being citizens in the political community

label: Citizenship revocation
description: Allows or prohibits revocation of citizenship, whereby a person is stripped of his or her citizenship

parent_category: Culture and Identity/Citizenship; Rights and Duties/Equality, Gender, and Minority Rights
label: Equality regardless of nationality
description: Equality regardless of a person's nationality or status as a national or subject of a particular country

parent_category: Culture and Identity/Citizenship; Rights and Duties/Equality, Gender, and Minority Rights
label: Equality regardless of origin
description: Equality regardless of a person's country of origin, birthplace, native home, motherland, fatherland, or ethnicity; protection from discrimination based on country of origin

label: Citizen deportation
description: Allows or prohibits deportation of citizens or residents

label: Birthright citizenship
description: Grants automatic citizenship at birth; may relate to the citizenship or residency of one or both parents, or to the location of an individual's birth

label: Naturalization
description: Grants citizenship to a foreigner through naturalization, whereby a person acquires a citizenship he or she did not have at birth

label: Entry or exit restrictions
description: Restrictions on entry into or exit out of the state, particularly with regard to the movements of foreign nationals

parent_category: Culture and Identity/Citizenship; Rights and Duties/Civil and Political Rights
label: Citizenship renunciation
description: Allows individuals to renounce their citizenship

parent_category: Culture and Identity/Indigenous Groups; Rights and Duties/Equality, Gender, and Minority Rights
label: Indigenous not pay taxes
description: Grants indigenous peoples an exemption from taxation or required financial charges levied on residents

parent_category: Culture and Identity/Indigenous Groups; Rights and Duties/Equality, Gender, and Minority Rights
label: Indigenous illegal activities
description: Grants indigenous peoples an exemption from laws that apply to the non-indigenous population

parent_category: Culture and Identity/Indigenous Groups; Elections/Political Parties; Rights and Duties/Equality, Gender, and Minority Rights
label: Indigenous political parties
description: Allows indigenous peoples to form political parties on the basis of group identity in order to acquire and exercise political power

parent_category: Culture and Identity/Indigenous Groups; Rights and Duties/Equality, Gender, and Minority Rights
label: Indigenous representation
description: Guarantees representation to indigenous peoples, for example, through reserved seats or quotas in the legislature

parent_category: Culture and Identity/Indigenous Groups; Rights and Duties/Equality, Gender, and Minority Rights
label: Indigenous self governance
description: Grants indigenous peoples autonomy to govern themselves, particularly with regard to issues that affect their territory

parent_category: Culture and Identity/Indigenous Groups; Elections/Suffrage and Turnout; Rights and Duties/Equality, Gender, and Minority Rights
label: Indigenous vote
description: Grants indigenous peoples the ability to vote in national elections or referenda, indicating their choice of candidate or course of action

parent_category: Culture and Identity/Language; Rights and Duties/Equality, Gender, and Minority Rights
label: Equality regardless of language
description: Equality regardless of a person's language or the shared system of words used to communicate

label: Official languages
description: Establishes official languages or national languages that are given special status, including endoglossic and exoglossic languages

label: Language protection
description: Allows individuals to use their native language, requires protection of different languages, or requires neutrality toward languages

parent_category: Culture and Identity/Language; Rights and Duties/Legal Procedural Rights
label: Trial in native language of accused
description: Allows individuals charged with an offense to be informed of the reason for their arrest in a language they understand, to have their trial conducted in a language they understand, or to have an interpreter during detention or trial if they cannot understand the language

parent_category: Culture and Identity/Race and Ethnicity; Rights and Duties/Equality, Gender, and Minority Rights
label: Equality regardless of race
description: Equality regardless of a person's race or group defined by shared history or social identity

parent_category: Culture and Identity/Race and Ethnicity; Rights and Duties/Equality, Gender, and Minority Rights
label: Equality regardless of tribe or clan
description: Equality regardless of a person's tribe, clan, or political or social group descending from a common ancestor; protection from discrimination based on tribe or clan

label: Ethnic community integration
description: Allows integration and partlcipation of minority ethnic communities; protects minority ethnic communities against forced assimilation; supports multinationalism, plurinationalism, or recognition of indigenous peoples

label: Wealth redistribution
description: Guarantees additional resources, funds, services, access, or opportunities to specific groups based on gender, ethnicity, disability, or any other group identity; seeks to increase economic opportunities, reduce inequalities, and use redistribution to create substantive equality

parent_category: Culture and Identity/Religion; Rights and Duties/Equality, Gender, and Minority Rights
label: Equality regardless of creed or belief
description: Equality regardless of a person's creed, ideology, doctrine, belief, viewpoint, or opinion; protection from discrimination based on creed or belief

parent_category: Culture and Identity/Religion; Rights and Duties/Equality, Gender, and Minority Rights
label: Equality regardless of religion
description: Equality regardless of a person's religion, religious faith, religious practice, or worship; protection from religious discrimination

parent_category: Culture and Identity/Religion; Judiciary/Structure of the Judiciary
label: Religious courts
description: Establishes religious courts that adjudicate matters arising in religious law, including ecclessiastical courts, Sharia courts, rabbinical courts, and Hindu courts; access may be limited on a confessional basis

parent_category: Culture and Identity/Religion; Rights and Duties/Civil and Political Rights
label: Freedom of religion
description: Allows individuals to hold religious beliefs, freely worship and practice those religious beliefs, change one's religion, or have no religion at all

label: God or other deities
description: Invocation of God, dieties, or the divine

label: Official religion
description: Creates or prohibits an official religion, national religion, or state religion; creates or prohibits special treatment for certain religions

label: Separation of church and state
description: Guarantees a secular state, guarantees a separation between the state and religious organizations, or forbids the state from extending recognition or assistance to religious organizations

label: Religious law
description: Establishes the status of religious law; establishes religious law as separate or integrated with secular law, as the default law where secular law is silent, as superior to secular law, as a source or inspiration for secular law, or as the supreme source of law; establishes a repugnancy clause preventing conflict with religious law

label: Tax status of religious organizations
description: Grants religious organizations an exemption from regular taxation

parent_category: Elections/Electoral Oversight; Regulation and Oversight/Elections; Regulation and Oversight/Independent Agencies and Commissions
label: Electoral commission
description: Establishes an independent commission to facilitate and regulate elections

parent_category: Elections/Electoral Oversight; Judiciary/Electoral Courts; Regulation and Oversight/Elections
label: Electoral court powers
description: Grants powers to the electoral court to hear challenges of election results and to certify various aspects of elections, including voter rolls and final election results

parent_category: Elections/Electoral Oversight; Judiciary/Electoral Courts; Regulation and Oversight/Elections
label: Electoral court removal
description: Establishes the grounds and competent bodies to remove an electoral court judge

parent_category: Elections/Electoral Oversight; Judiciary/Electoral Courts; Regulation and Oversight/Elections
label: Electoral court selection
description: Establishes the process and bodies competent to nominate and approve an electoral court judge

parent_category: Elections/Electoral Oversight; Judiciary/Electoral Courts; Regulation and Oversight/Elections
label: Electoral court term length
description: Number of years that an electoral court judge serves in a term

parent_category: Elections/Electoral Oversight; Judiciary/Electoral Courts; Regulation and Oversight/Elections
label: Electoral court term limits
description: Maximum number of terms that an electoral court judge serves

parent_category: Elections/Electoral Oversight; Judiciary/Electoral Courts; Regulation and Oversight/Elections
label: Electoral court eligibility
description: Qualifications that an individual must meet in order to serve as an electoral court judge

parent_category: Elections/Electoral Oversight; Judiciary/Electoral Courts; Regulation and Oversight/Elections
label: Electoral court age
description: Minimum age that an individual must have attained before assuming the office of electoral court judge

label: Campaign financing
description: Rules that political parties and candidates must follow in financing electoral campaigns

label: Census
description: Provides for the enumeration of residents periodically

label: Electoral districts
description: Characteristics of electoral districts or rules for establishing electoral districts

label: Election schedule
description: Schedule for holding elections, described in terms of a particular day, an interval between elections, or in relation to the dismissal of the legislature or executive

label: Citizen secret ballot
description: Requires electoral ballots to be secret such that the voter completes the ballot privately and the ballot cannot be connected to the voter

parent_category: Elections/Political Parties; Rights and Duties/Citizen Duties
label: Required political parties
description: Requires membership in a political party or in the sole political party of the state

parent_category: Elections/Political Parties; Rights and Duties/Equality, Gender, and Minority Rights
label: Equality regardless of political party
description: Equality regardless of a person's political opinions, political party membership, or affiliation with a group organized to acquire and exercise political power; protection from discrimination based on political party

label: Preferred political parties
description: Grants special status to a particular political party or type of political party

label: Prohibited political parties
description: Prohibits certain political parties or parties with particular ideologies or characteristics

label: Political party regulation
description: Describes which branch or body has the power to regulate political parties and determine the unconstitutionality of certain parties

label: Political party restrictions
description: Establishes the rules of acceptable political party activity and organizational structure

label: Political party formation
description: Allows individuals to form or join a political party or political organization

label: Legislative initiatives
description: Allows individuals to propose new legislative initiatives

label: Referenda
description: Allows individuals to vote for or against a specific piece of proposed legislation in a referendum, plebiscite, or other public vote

parent_category: Elections/Suffrage and Turnout; Rights and Duties/Civil and Political Rights
label: Universal suffrage
description: Allows all individuals to vote

label: Compulsory voting
description: Makes voting mandatory for at least some electors in some elections

label: Voting restrictions
description: Qualifications or restrictions on voting, for example on the basis of residency, age, or registration

label: Cabinet/minister removal
description: Establishes the grounds and competent bodies to dismiss cabinet members or ministers

label: Cabinet/minister selection
description: Establishes the process and bodies competent to nominate and approve cabinet members or ministers

label: Cabinet/minister eligibility
description: Qualifications that an individual must meet in order to serve as a cabinet member or minister

label: Cabinet/ministers
description: Establishes the cabinet or council of ministers as a body of officials who act as the heads of agencies or ministries and advise the head of state or head of government

label: Cabinet/minister powers
description: Powers of the cabinet, council of ministers, or ministers

label: Executive independence
description: Guarantees the independence of the executive

label: Commander in chief
description: Establishes the person who has ultimate control of the armed forces

parent_category: Executive/Executive Independence and Power; Executive/Head of Government
label: Head of government decree power
description: Allows the head of government, prime minister, cabinet, or council of ministers to enact rules without following the usual channels for the passage of legislation

parent_category: Executive/Executive Independence and Power; Executive/Head of Government
label: Head of government immunity
description: Provides the head of government or prime minister with immunity from prosecution

parent_category: Executive/Executive Independence and Power; Executive/Head of Government
label: Head of government powers
description: Grants specific, enumerated powers to the head of government or prime minister

parent_category: Executive/Executive Independence and Power; Executive/Head of Government
label: Head of government removal
description: Establishes the grounds and competent bodies to dismiss the head of government or prime minister

parent_category: Executive/Executive Independence and Power; Executive/Head of State
label: Head of state decree power
description: Allows the head of state, president, or monarch to enact rules without following the usual channels for the passage of legislation

parent_category: Executive/Executive Independence and Power; Executive/Head of State
label: Head of state powers
description: Grants specific, enumerated powers to the head of state, president, or monarch

parent_category: Executive/Executive Independence and Power; Executive/Head of State
label: Head of state removal
description: Establishes the grounds and competent bodies to dismiss the head of state, president, or monarch

parent_category: Executive/Executive Independence and Power; Legislature/Legislative Rules and Restrictions
label: Legislative oversight of the executive
description: Allows the legislature to oversee the executive to provide a check on the misuse or abuse of executive power and to ensure that executive agencies are enforcing the laws according to the intent of the legislature

parent_category: Executive/Executive Independence and Power; Executive/Head of Government
label: Head of government removal limits
description: Protects the head of government or prime minister from removal after a failed attempt to remove the head of government

label: Pardon power
description: Grants an executive body power to overrule a criminal conviction

label: Head of government eligibility
description: Qualifications that an individual must meet in order to serve as the head of government or prime minister

label: Head of government replacement
description: Establishes the process and bodies competent to replace the head of government or prime minister before the normally scheduled replacement process

label: Head of government selection
description: Establishes the process and bodies competent to nominate and approve the head of government or prime minister

label: Head of government term length
description: Number of years that a head of government or prime minister serves in a term

label: Head of government term limits
description: Maximum number of terms that a head of government or prime minister serves

label: Head of government legislative role
description: Requires or prohibits the head of government or prime minister to serve as a member of the legislature

label: Head of government age
description: Minimum age that an individual must have attained before assuming the office of head of government or prime minister

label: Head of state advisory bodies
description: Establishes advisory bodies to advise the head of state, president, or monarch

label: Head of state eligibility
description: Qualifications that an individual must meet in order to serve as the head of state, president, or monarch

label: Head of state immunity
description: Provides the head of state, president, or monarch with immunity from prosecution

label: Head of state replacement
description: Establishes the process and bodies competent to replace the head of state, president, or monarch before the normally scheduled replacement process; head of state succession process

label: Head of state selection
description: Establishes the process and bodies competent to nominate and approve the head of state, president, or monarch; may include direct election, appointment, or heredity

label: Head of state term length
description: Number of years that a head of state, president, or monarch serves in a term

label: Head of state term limits
description: Maximum number of terms that a head of state, president, or monarch serves

label: Head of state age
description: Minimum age that an individual must have attained before assuming the office of head of state, president, or monarch

label: Military service
description: Requires individuals to serve in the military for a specified period of time

label: Emergencies
description: Allows calling a state of emergency, siege, or martial law

label: Military courts
description: Establishes military courts that enforce military law and adjudicate charges against members of the military

label: War
description: Allows establishing a declaration of war

label: Defense minister eligibility
description: Qualifications that an individual must meet in order to serve as the defense minister, particularly being a civilian or a member of the military; specification that there be civilian control of the military

label: Military restrictions
description: Limitations on use of the military or actions of members of the military

label: Military commander selection
description: Establishes the process and bodies competent to nominate and approve active-duty commanders in the military

label: Terrorism
description: Legal and security procedures regarding terrorism

label: Attorney general
description: Establishes an attorney general, public prosecutor, or prosecutor general to serve as the principal legal official, represent the government in legal proceedings, and give legal advice to the government

label: Deputy executive
description: Establishes a deputy head of state, deputy vice president, deputy head of government, or deputy prime minister

label: Executive structure
description: Establishes the structure of the executive as a single office or dual executive

label: Federal review of subnational legislation
description: Federal review of the legislation of the subnational units in a federation

label: National vs subnational laws
description: Establishes which level of government has supremacy in cases where federal and subnational laws conflict

label: Territory accession
description: Allows adoption or incorporation of new territory

label: Territory secession
description: Allows withdrawal or independence of groups or territory

label: Municipal government
description: Establishes the structures and competencies of municipal, local, county, or district government

label: Subsidiary unit government
description: Establishes the structures and competencies of provincial, regional, or state government

parent_category: International Law/Explicit References to Int. Law
label: Customary international law
description: Reference to customary international law, the law of nations, or the generally accepted principles of international law

parent_category: International Law/Explicit References to Int. Law; International Law/Treaties
label: International human rights treaties
description: Reference to one or more specific international treaties or instruments concerning human rights

parent_category: International Law/Explicit References to Int. Law
label: International law
description: Reference to international law, including treaties, agreements, norms, or other commitments

parent_category: International Law/Explicit References to Int. Law
label: International organizations
description: Reference to international organizations, whether generally or with regard to specific international organizations such as the United Nations

label: Foreign affairs representative
description: Representative for foreign affairs authoritized to speak abroad

label: Treaty legal status
description: Establishes whether treaties are superior or inferior to domestic legal documents

label: Treaty ratification
description: Procedures to gain approval for accession to a treaty

label: Administrative court selection
description: Establishes the process and bodies competent to nominate and approve an administrative court judge

label: Administrative court term length
description: Number of years that an administrative court judge serves in a term

label: Administrative court term limits
description: Maximum number of terms that an administrative court judge serves

label: Administrative court eligibility
description: Qualifications that an individual must meet in order to serve as an administrative court judge

parent_category: Judiciary/Administrative Courts; Judiciary/Structure of the Judiciary
label: Administrative courts
description: Establishes administreative courts that adjudicate disputes about administrative exercise of power

label: Administrative court age
description: Minimum age that an individual must have attained before assuming the office of administrative court judge

label: Ultra-vires administrative actions
description: Protects individuals from illegal administrative actions or use of excess power by administrative agencies

label: Constitutional court opinions
description: Determines procedures for, or treatment of, judicial opinions handed down by the constitutional court

parent_category: Judiciary/Constitutional Court; Judiciary/Judicial Autonomy and Power
label: Constitutional court powers
description: Establishes the competencies of the constitutional court

parent_category: Judiciary/Constitutional Court; Judiciary/Judicial Autonomy and Power
label: Constitutional court removal
description: Establishes the grounds and competent bodies to dismiss a constitutional court judge

label: Constitutional court selection
description: Establishes the process and bodies competent to nominate and approve a constitutional court judge

label: Constitutional court term length
description: Number of years that a constitutional court judge serves in a term

label: Constitutional court term limits
description: Maximum number of terms that a constitutional court judge serves

label: Constitutional court eligibility
description: Qualifications that an individual must meet in order to serve as a constitutional court judge

parent_category: Judiciary/Constitutional Court; Judiciary/Structure of the Judiciary
label: Constitutional court
description: Establishes a constitutional court that interprets the constitution and rules on whether legislation aligns with the principles of the constitution

label: Constitutional court age
description: Minimum age that an individual must have attained before assuming the office of constitutional court judge

parent_category: Judiciary/Judicial Autonomy and Power; Judiciary/Judicial Review
label: Constitutional interpretation
description: Establishes the bodies competent to interpret the constitution

parent_category: Judiciary/Judicial Autonomy and Power; Judiciary/Judicial Review
label: Constitutionality of legislation
description: Procedures for examining whether the content of a piece of legislation is in accord with the constitution

label: Judicial independence
description: Guarantees that judges are autonomous and the judiciary is independent

label: Judicial precedent
description: Requirees judges to consider or follow precedents set by rulings in higher courts

label: Judicial retirement age
description: Maximum age at which judges must retire

label: Judicial salary and budget
description: Prevents tampering with the salaries of judges or the budget of the judiciary

parent_category: Judiciary/Judicial Autonomy and Power; Judiciary/Supreme Court
label: Supreme court powers
description: Establishes the competencies of the supreme court

label: Supreme/ordinary court removal
description: Establishes the grounds and competent bodies to dismiss a supreme or ordinary court judge

parent_category: Judiciary/Judicial Review; Rights and Duties/Enforcement; Rights and Duties/Legal Procedural Rights
label: Amparo
description: Allows individuals to request judicial review of actions they believe have violated or infringed their rights

label: Ordinary court eligibility
description: Qualifications that an individual must meet in order to serve as an ordinary court judge

label: Ordinary court age
description: Minimum age that an individual must have attained before assuming the office of ordinary court judge

label: Ordinary court selection
description: Establishes the process and competent bodies to nominate and approve an ordinary court judge

label: Ordinary court term length
description: Number of years that an ordinary court judge serves in a term

label: Ordinary court term limits
description: Maximum number of terms that an ordinary court judge serves

label: Courts for judging public officials
description: Establishes courts that review the actions of public servants acting in their official capacity

parent_category: Judiciary/Structure of the Judiciary; Rights and Duties/Enforcement
label: Amparo courts
description: Establishes courts of amparo that determine whether an individual's rights were infringed or violated

parent_category: Judiciary/Structure of the Judiciary; Regulation and Oversight/Independent Agencies and Commissions
label: Judicial council
description: Establishes a body to monitor, review, select, promote, or remove judges

label: Labor courts
description: Establishes labor courts that adjudicate disputes between individuals and trade unions or businesses

label: Tax courts
description: Establishes tax courts that adjudicate disputes between individuals or businesses and the state with regard to taxation

label: Judiciary structure
description: Establishes the basic organization of the judicial branch

label: Supreme court eligibility
description: Qualifications that an individual must meet in order to serve as a supreme court judge

label: Supreme court age
description: Minimum age that an individual must have attained before assuming the office of supreme court judge

label: Supreme court opinions
description: Determines procedures for, or treatment of, judicial opinions handed down by the supreme court

label: Supreme court selection
description: Establishes the process and competent bodies to nominate and approve a supreme court judge

label: Supreme court term length
description: Number of years that a supreme court judge serves in a term

label: Supreme court term limits
description: Maximum number of terms that a supreme court judge serves

label: First chamber eligibility
description: Qualifications that an individual must meet in order to serve a legislator or parliamentarian in the first chamber of the legislature

label: First chamber quota
description: Number of seats in the first chamber of the legislature that must be assigned to representatives of a particular group

label: First chamber policy areas
description: Policy areas where the first chamber of the legislature has special privileges or restrictions

label: First chamber selection
description: Establishes the process to select members of the first chamber of the legislature through proportional representation, ranked-choice voting, majoritian voting, or other selection mechanisms

label: First chamber leader
description: Office that presides over the first chamber of the legislature

label: First chamber age
description: Minimum age that an individual must have attained to be eligible to serve as a representative in the first chamber of the legislature

label: First chamber size
description: Total number of seats in the first chamber of the legislature

label: First chamber term length
description: Number of years that a legislator serves in a term in the first chamber of the legislature

label: First chamber term limit
description: Maximum number of terms that a legislator may serve in the first chamber of the legislature; limit on re-election to the the legislature, congress, or parliament

label: Legislation approval
description: Identifies which body has the power to approve or reject legislation after it has been passed by the legislature

label: Legislative division of labor
description: Specifies the manner in which the work of the legislative process is divided between the two chambers of the legislature, including reserved policy areas, powers, or concurrent or sequential consideration of legislation

label: Legislation initiation
description: Specifies who has the power to propose new legislation

label: Legislation supermajority
description: Requires a supermajority of a specified size to pass legislation

label: Veto override
description: Allows the legislature to take additional steps to pass legislation that has been vetoed by the actor responsible for approving or rejecting legislation

parent_category: Legislature/Legislative Independence and Power; Legislature/Removal and Replacement
label: Legislature dismissal
description: Establishes the grounds and competent bodies to dismiss the entire legislature

parent_category: Legislature/Legislative Independence and Power; Legislature/Removal and Replacement
label: Legislator immunity
description: Provides members of the legislature with immunity from prosecution

parent_category: Legislature/Legislative Independence and Power; Legislature/Removal and Replacement
label: Legislator removal
description: Establishes the grounds and competent bodies to dismiss, remove, or revoke the mandate of a legislator or parliamentarian

parent_category: Legislature/Legislative Independence and Power; Legislature/Removal and Replacement
label: Legislator replacement
description: Establishes the grounds and competent bodies to replace a legislator before the normally scheduled replacement process

label: Legislator attendance
description: Requires legislators to attend legislative sessions or votes

label: Legislator compensation
description: Specifies the actors involved in setting legislators' compensation

label: Legislator asset disclosure
description: Requires legislators to disclose their income or the value of their assets

label: Extraordinary legislative session
description: Establishes who has the authority to call an extraordinary session of the legislature

label: Joint legislative session
description: Provides for the two chambers of a bicameral legislature to meet jointly as a body made up of both chambers or a special joint session

label: Legislative session length
description: Number of days or months that the legislature meets within a year

label: Legislator outside professions
description: Defines outside professions that are incompatible with serving as a legislator or bars legislators from engaging in some or all other occupations during their term in office

label: Public legislative sessions
description: Requires the legislature to hold legislative meetings in public sessions or specifies when the legislature may hold legislative meetings in private sessions

label: Legislative deliberations
description: Requires that a written record of legislative debates or deliberations be published

label: Legislative quorum
description: Requires a certain percentage of legislators to be present to hold an official legislative session

label: Legislative vote transparency
description: Establishes the level of transparency in legislative voting, including making legislative votes a matter of public record or secret

label: Second chamber eligibility
description: Qualifications that an individual must meet in order to serve as a legislator in the second chamber of the legislature

label: Second chamber leader
description: Office that presides over the second chamber of the legislature

label: Second chamber age
description: Minimum age that an individual must have attained to be eligible to serve as a representative in the second chamber of the legislature

label: Second chamber quota
description: Number of seats in the second chamber of the legislature that must be assigned to representatives of a particular group

label: Second chamber policy areas
description: Policy areas where the second chamber of the legislature has special privileges or restrictions

label: Second chamber selection
description: Establishes the process to select members of the second chamber of the legislature through proportional representation, ranked-choice voting, majoritian voting, or other selection mechanisms

label: Second chamber size
description: Total number of seats in the second chamber of the legislature

label: Second chamber term length
description: Number of years that a legislator serves in a term in the second chamber of the legislature

label: Second chamber term limits
description: Maximum number of terms that a legislator may serve in the second chamber of the legislature; limit on re-election to the the legislature, congress, or parliament

label: Balanced budget
description: Requires that the government pass a budget in which incoming revenue meets or exceeds the value of the government's expenditures in a fiscal year

label: Budget law
description: Special legislative process for budget, which is legislation that lays out the revenues and expenditures for some period of time, usually in years

label: Economic plans
description: Process for national economic plans

label: Finance law
description: Special legislative process for finance legislation on borrowing money

label: Organic law
description: Special legislative process for organic laws that create fundamental aspects of the constitutional order

label: Spending law
description: Special legislative process for spending legislation on expenditures

label: Tax law
description: Special legislative process for tax legislation on collecting revenue in the form of taxes or tariffs

label: Legislative committees
description: Defines existence, formation, or procedures of legislative committees

label: Standing committees
description: Establishes permanent committees with oversight in given policy areas

label: Legislature structure
description: Establishes the structure of the legislature as a unicameral body with one chamber or a bicameral body with two chambers

label: Civil service recruitment
description: Requires that civil servants are recruited and promoted on the basis of merit through standardized exams or credentials; protects against patronage, nepotism, and corruption

label: Colonies
description: Defines the status of occupied territories including colonies, protectorates, or territories

label: Crimes of the previous regime
description: Provides transitional justice that punishes or pardons crimes committed by the previous regime

label: Motives for writing constitution
description: Frames the constitution in a particular context and history

label: Constitutional oath
description: Requires certain public officials to take an oath to support the constitution

label: Natural resources ownership
description: Describes ownership, possession, and use of natural resources, including energy, minerals, water, forests, flora, fauna, air, land, or other natural resources; includes nationalization, privatization, and use of natural resources as a public good or consumer good

label: Political theorists and figures
description: Reference to teachings of historical figures, theorists, or philosophers

label: Art
description: Reference to art or artists

label: History
description: Reference to particular triumphs or tragedies in history

label: Fraternity and solidarity
description: Reference to fraternity or solidarity

label: Science
description: Reference to science, scientific research, or innovation

label: Regional groups
description: Reference to a broader regional group, geographic region, or multilateral organization

label: Source of constitutional authority
description: Establishes the agent with the authority to install the constitution or from which the state derives its ultimate authority

label: Government system
description: Establishes the structure and system of government

parent_category: Principles and Symbols/State Definition and Symbols
label: Anthem
description: Establishes the anthem

parent_category: Principles and Symbols/State Definition and Symbols
label: Capital
description: Establishes the capital city

parent_category: Principles and Symbols/State Definition and Symbols
label: Flag
description: Describes the flag

parent_category: Principles and Symbols/State Definition and Symbols
label: Motto
description: Establishes the motto

parent_category: Regulation and Oversight/Independent Agencies and Commissions
label: Bank
description: Establishes a bank that formulates monetary policy, issues currency, regulates commercial banks, and provides financial and banking services

parent_category: Regulation and Oversight/Independent Agencies and Commissions
label: Counter corruption commission
description: Establishes an independent commission to investigate corruption

parent_category: Regulation and Oversight/Independent Agencies and Commissions; Rights and Duties/Enforcement
label: Human rights commission
description: Establishes an independent commission to investigate potential violations of human rights

parent_category: Regulation and Oversight/Independent Agencies and Commissions; Regulation and Oversight/Media and Communications
label: Media commission
description: Establishes an independent commission to regulate mass media

parent_category: Regulation and Oversight/Independent Agencies and Commissions; Rights and Duties/Enforcement
label: Ombudsman
description: Establishes an independent body to investigate improper or illegal actions that infringe on individual rights

parent_category: Regulation and Oversight/Independent Agencies and Commissions
label: Truth and reconciliation commission
description: Establishes an independent commission to hear testimony about human rights violations and other crimes committed by the previous regime

label: Radio
description: Reference to the wireless transmission of audio programs

label: State media
description: Requires, allows, or bans state operation of media

label: Telecommunications
description: Reference to wired or wireless communication, including telephones, satellites, the internet, and other communication technologies

label: Television
description: Reference to the wireless transmission of audio-visual programs

label: Taxes requirement
description: Requires individuals to pay taxes

label: Work requirement
description: Requires individuals to work

parent_category: Rights and Duties/Civil and Political Rights
label: Freedom of assembly
description: Allows individuals to gather in groups or protest

parent_category: Rights and Duties/Civil and Political Rights
label: Freedom of association
description: Allows individuals to form or join a group or association

parent_category: Rights and Duties/Civil and Political Rights
label: Freedom of expression
description: Allows individuals to express their thoughts and feelings without prior censorship or interference

parent_category: Rights and Duties/Civil and Political Rights
label: Freedom of movement
description: Allows individuals to travel and reside anywhere

parent_category: Rights and Duties/Civil and Political Rights
label: Freedom of opinion, thought, and conscience
description: Allows individuals to believe or think anything they find compelling

parent_category: Rights and Duties/Civil and Political Rights
label: Freedom of press
description: Allows individuals, journalists, and publishers free expression through all forms of media

parent_category: Rights and Duties/Civil and Political Rights
label: Human dignity
description: Reference to human dignity as a fundamental value

parent_category: Rights and Duties/Civil and Political Rights
label: Civil marriage
description: Recognizes marriage performed by administrative official

parent_category: Rights and Duties/Civil and Political Rights
label: Petition
description: Allows individuals to bring petitions and complaints

parent_category: Rights and Duties/Civil and Political Rights
label: Academic freedom
description: Allows scholars to research and teach without interference

parent_category: Rights and Duties/Civil and Political Rights
label: Bear arms
description: Allows individuals to possess firearms and other weapons

parent_category: Rights and Duties/Civil and Political Rights
label: Conscientious objection
description: Grants an exemption from military service to individuals who object to war on the basis of moral principles

parent_category: Rights and Duties/Civil and Political Rights
label: Personality development
description: Allows individuals to develop and express their own unique personality

parent_category: Rights and Duties/Civil and Political Rights
label: Found a family
description: Allows individuals to commit to one another and raise children together

parent_category: Rights and Duties/Civil and Political Rights
label: Information
description: Allows individuals to access information collected or held by the government, particularly information about oneself or of general public interest

parent_category: Rights and Duties/Civil and Political Rights
label: Marriage
description: Allows individuals to enter into a legally recognized, long-term commitment to one another

parent_category: Rights and Duties/Civil and Political Rights
label: Overthrow
description: Allows individuals to revolt, start a revolution, or overthrow the government

parent_category: Rights and Duties/Civil and Political Rights
label: Privacy
description: Protects individuals from intrusion into their property, papers, person, or communications without proper authorization

parent_category: Rights and Duties/Civil and Political Rights
label: Reputation
description: Allows individuals to defend themselves against libel or slander

parent_category: Rights and Duties/Civil and Political Rights
label: Children
description: Affords children special benefits or protections

parent_category: Rights and Duties/Civil and Political Rights
label: Debtors
description: Protects individuals who are unable to repay loans or other contracts

label: Expropriation
description: Protects individuals from confiscation of property without proper compensation

label: Intellectual property
description: Allows individuals to protect and profit from their creative works, including copyrights, patents, and trademarks

label: Occupation
description: Allows individuals to choose their occupation and their place of employment without interference

label: Competitive marketplace
description: Protects individuals from monopolies, price fixing, and other means of reducing competition in the marketplace

label: Business
description: Allows individuals to establish for-profit commercial endeavors

label: Own property
description: Allows individuals to own real property and other objects

label: Transfer property
description: Allows individuals to dispose of property through sale, gift, wills, inheritance, or other means

label: Inalienable
description: Grants rights that are understood to be inalienable, unassailable, inviolable, or absolute

parent_category: Rights and Duties/Equality, Gender, and Minority Rights
label: Equality for persons with disabilities
description: Equality regardless of a person's disability or a physical or mental condition that limits the person's movements, senses, or activities; protection from discrimination based on disability

parent_category: Rights and Duties/Equality, Gender, and Minority Rights
label: Equality regardless of age
description: Equality regardless of a person's age, the length of time the person has lived, or status as a child, juvenile, minor, senior, or elder; protection from age discrimination

parent_category: Rights and Duties/Equality, Gender, and Minority Rights
label: Equality regardless of financial status
description: Equality regardless of a person's financial status, assets, economic resources, or property ownership; protection from discrimination based on financial status

parent_category: Rights and Duties/Equality, Gender, and Minority Rights
label: Equality regardless of gender
description: Equality regardless of a person's gender, sex, or status as a woman, man, transgender woman, or transgender man; women's rights promoting equality of women with men; protection from sexism or discrimination based on gender

parent_category: Rights and Duties/Equality, Gender, and Minority Rights
label: Equality regardless of parentage
description: Equality regardless of a person's parentage, bloodline, lineage, family, paternity, heredity, or birth; protection from discrimination based on parentage

parent_category: Rights and Duties/Equality, Gender, and Minority Rights
label: Equality regardless of sexual orientation
description: Equality regardless of a person's sexual orientation or status as gay, lesbian, bisexual, queer, or straight; protection from discrimination based on sexual orientation

parent_category: Rights and Duties/Equality, Gender, and Minority Rights
label: Equality regardless of skin color
description: Equality regardless of a person's physical characteristic of skin color

parent_category: Rights and Duties/Equality, Gender, and Minority Rights
label: Equality regardless of social status
description: Equality regardless of social status, social position, or social stature; protection from discrimination based on social status

parent_category: Rights and Duties/Equality, Gender, and Minority Rights
label: Equality before the law
description: Guarantees that all individuals are entitled to the same privileges and immunities

parent_category: Rights and Duties/Equality, Gender, and Minority Rights
label: Social class
description: Refers to social class

parent_category: Rights and Duties/Equality, Gender, and Minority Rights
label: Stateless persons
description: Requires protection for stateless persons, asylum seekers, or refugees

parent_category: Rights and Duties/Equality, Gender, and Minority Rights
label: Matrimonial equality
description: Grants spouses the same rights in marriage and family law

parent_category: Rights and Duties/Equality, Gender, and Minority Rights
label: Rights restrictions
description: Allows restrictions on the rights of some individuals or groups

parent_category: Rights and Duties/Equality, Gender, and Minority Rights
label: Culture
description: Allows individuals to practice their culture

parent_category: Rights and Duties/Equality, Gender, and Minority Rights
label: Self determination
description: Allows people to determine their own governance

label: Binding effect of rights
description: Establishes whether or not private individuals are bound by rights

label: Constitutional adherence
description: Requires public officials or individuals to obey, or abide by, the constitution

label: Extradition
description: Requires or prohibits the extradition of suspected or convicted criminals to other countries

label: Due process
description: Requires defendants in criminal trials to have their cases heard according to the process established by law

label: Jury
description: Requires a jury or body of people legally selected and sworn to adjudicate guilt in criminal trials

label: Presumption of innocence
description: Requires that those adjudicating a criminal trial presume the accused is ""innocent until proven guilty,"" placing the burden of proof on the side of the prosecution in the trial

label: No punishment without law
description: Prohibits arrest, detention, prosecution, or punishment for actions that are not defined in law as crimes; prohibits sentences that are greater than those defined in law

label: Prison registry
description: Requires a registry of the names of people imprisoned

label: Juvenile privileges in criminal process
description: Grants juveniles charged with crimes special protections in the criminal justice process, including special courts, different sentencing rules, or special detention centers

label: Double jeopardy
description: Prohibits charging an individual with an offense for which they have already been acquitted

label: Ex post facto laws
description: Prohibits arrest, detention, prosecution, or punishment for acts that were not criminal at the time they were committed; prohibits imposition of penalties that were enacted after an act was committed

label: False imprisonment
description: Provides redress for individuals who have been confined or arrested without just cause, or have otherwise suffered from judicial error

label: Self-incrimination
description: Allows an individual to refuse to answer questions during an interrogation or in court if the questions would tend to confirm the individual's guilt

label: Unjustified restraint
description: Protects individuals from unjustified restraint, arbitrary detention, and improper arrest; specifies habeas corpus requirement to bring the accused before a judge or court to consider the person's release unless lawful grounds are shown for the detention

label: Victims
description: Addresses needs of crime victims in the justice process

label: Evidence collection
description: Regulates collection of evidence, searches and seizures, or involuntary confessions

label: Appeal
description: Allows individuals to appeal a judicial decision in a higher court if they are not satisfied with the outcome in the court of first instance

label: Counsel
description: Allows arrested individuals to have legal counsel

label: Evidence examination
description: Allows accused offenders and their legal counsel to cross-examine evidence or witnesses brought against them

label: Fair trial
description: Provides for a fair, impartial trial; protects individuals from unfair trial procedures

label: Pre-trial defense
description: Requires arrested individuals to be released from custody until the time of their trial

label: Public trial
description: Requires individuals charged with an offense to have their trial held in public

label: Speedy trial
description: Requires individuals charged with an offense to be brought to trial without undue delay and within a reasonable time following the arrest

label: Death penalty
description: Forbids use of the death penalty as a punishment

label: Corporal punishment
description: Forbids inflicting physical harm as a punishment

label: Cruel treatment
description: Forbids inhumane treatment or treating individuals in any way that offends human dignity

label: Slavery
description: Forbids the practice of forced labor, servitude, and owning or otherwise exploiting human beings

label: Torture
description: Forbids the use of torture or coerced confessions

label: Life
description: Guarantees a right to life

label: Higher education
description: Guarantees individuals equal access to higher education

label: Compulsory education
description: Requires children to attend school

label: Free education
description: Requires the provision of education free of charge

label: Child employment
description: Prohibits or limits child labor to protect children from exploitation

label: Consumers
description: Protects consumers from harmful products and/or predatory or unethical business practices

label: Environment
description: Requires protection or preservation of the environment

label: Scientific benefits
description: Allows individuals to enjoy the benefits of scientific progress

label: Equal pay for equal work
description: Requires just remuneration, a fair salary, minimum wage, living wge, or equal payment for work; prohibits paying employees low wages or different rates for the same work

label: Health care
description: Provides health care to individuals

label: Trade union
description: Allows individuals to form and join trade unions or professional organizations

label: Standard of living
description: Allows individuals to have a reasonable standard of living, including basic needs, decent living conditions, an adequate well-being, suitable existence, quality of life, dignified life, or life worthy of a human being

label: Leisure
description: Allows individuals to have leisure, including vacations, weekly holidays, or leaves with pay

label: Safe work
description: Allows individuals to have safe working conditions free of preventable hazards

label: Shelter
description: Allows individuals to have adequate shelter or housing

label: Strike
description: Allows individuals to cease work for a period of time to exert pressure on their employer

label: Employment
description: Requires provision of work to individuals

label: Support for children
description: Requires provision of financial or material support to children

label: Support for the disabled
description: Requires provision of financial or material support to persons with disabilities

label: Support for the elderly
description: Requires provision of financial or material support to elderly persons

label: Support for the unemployed
description: Requires provision of financial or material support to unemployed persons

label: Preamble
description: Introductory language before the main text begins

label: Transition
description: Temporary text that guides the transition from the previous system to the new system

label: Democracy
description: Governance controlled by the people

label: Rule of law
description: Requires state actions based on the rule of law, legality, rechtsstasst, or justice; restricts the arbitrary exercise of power by requiring adherence to clear, established laws

label: Voting age
description: Minimum age limit for voting

label: Social security
description: Guarantees the social security of the society
